modules.description: Provides operations to compute hash values and fold hash states for a given type `t`. Works with the `Base.Hash.state` and `Base.Hash.hash_value` types to enable efficient hashing. Used to generate consistent hash representations for custom types in hash tables and related data structures.

Generates hash functions from type definitions and expressions using custom syntax extensions. It processes OCaml types, records, and variants, allowing selective ignoring of fields with attributes. Produces a hash_fold_t function for integrating with the Hash module.

Encapsulates hash computation and state folding for arbitrary types, leveraging `Base.Hash.state` and `Base.Hash.hash_value` to produce consistent hash representations. Enables efficient hashing of custom types for use in hash tables and similar structures. Supports incremental hash updates through state manipulation. Can generate unique hash values for complex data structures like records and variants.

Generates hash functions for OCaml types by transforming core types into expressions that fold values into a hash state. Operates on `Ppxlib.core_type`, `Ppxlib.expression`, and `Ppxlib.type_declaration` to produce hashable representations. Used to automatically derive hash functions for custom types in ppx rewriters.
